title: Ticket #901: DOC: Authorization level documentation needs to be made consistent
description: The manual refers to Authorization Levels as Authorization/Security/Permission Levels, depending on which part of the manual you are reading.
remarks:
2009-Dec-28 10:42:34 by smoler:
Karen cannot find any instances of this inconsistant wording. And, since the correct term used throughout is "access level", please identify strings from the prose of section 3.6 (which is large) to help me find them. A search of the prose does not locate any problems!

2010-Aug-18 20:26:30 by matt:
Trivial search of http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.5/3_6Security.html reveals at least:

--

The control lists are defined by configuration settings that contain SETTABLE_ATTRS in their name. The name of the control lists have the following form:

<SUBSYS>.SETTABLE_ATTRS_<PERMISSION-LEVEL>

The two parts of this name that can vary are the <PERMISSION-LEVEL> and the <SUBSYS>. The <PERMISSION-LEVEL> can be any of the security access levels described earlier in this section. Examples include WRITE, OWNER, and CONFIG.

--

A permission-level is an access-level, why even have permission-level. Other instances of this confusion probably still exist.
